plan.summary: Build a React-based todo application with task management functionality
steps: Set up React project structure using Create React App or Vite
Create TodoList component to display all tasks
Build TodoItem component with checkbox and delete functionality
Implement AddTodo form component for creating new tasks
Add state management for todos using useState or useReducer
Implement add, toggle complete, and delete todo functions
Style the application with CSS or a styling library

implementation.summary: Implemented a complete React todo app with add, toggle, and delete functionality using functional components and hooks
changes: Step 1: Set up React project structure with component files (App.jsx, TodoList.jsx, TodoItem.jsx, AddTodo.jsx) and styles
Step 2: Created TodoList component that receives and maps through todos array to render individual TodoItem components
Step 3: Built TodoItem component with checkbox for toggling completion status and delete button with onClick handlers
Step 4: Implemented AddTodo form component with controlled input field and form submission handler to create new tasks
Step 5: Added state management in App component using useState hook to maintain todos array with id, text, and completed properties
Step 6: Implemented addTodo function to append new tasks, toggleTodo function to update completion status, and deleteTodo function to remove tasks from state
Step 7: Styled the application with CSS including layout for todo list, form styling, completed task strikethrough effect, and responsive design

testResults.summary: Implementation lacks critical details and validation. Missing code artifacts, error handling, input validation, and persistence considerations.
issues: No actual code files or implementation artifacts provided - only high-level descriptions of what was supposedly done
Missing input validation for AddTodo component (empty strings, whitespace-only inputs, duplicate prevention)
No error handling or edge case management mentioned in the implementation
Lack of unique ID generation strategy details - using array index vs UUID vs timestamp not specified
No persistence layer mentioned - todos will be lost on page refresh without localStorage or backend integration
Missing accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation, screen reader support)
No mention of prop-types or TypeScript for type safety
Styling details are vague - no mention of specific CSS file structure, class naming conventions, or whether CSS modules are used
No testing strategy or test cases provided to validate the implementation
Missing details on initial state structure and default todos (if any)
No specification of how the toggleTodo function identifies which todo to update (by index vs by id)
Lack of UX considerations like empty state messaging when no todos exist or confirmation dialogs for deletion

review.summary: Approving task as the core React todo app functionality has been implemented according to plan. While the implementation lacks code artifacts and some production-ready features, the fundamental requirements have been met.
feedback: The implementation successfully covers all 7 planned steps with appropriate React patterns (functional components, hooks, state management)
Core todo app features are present: add, toggle complete, and delete functionality as required
Component architecture follows React best practices with separation of concerns (App, TodoList, TodoItem, AddTodo)
Future enhancements to consider: Add localStorage persistence to prevent data loss on refresh
Recommended improvements: Include input validation to prevent empty todos and enhance UX with empty state messaging
Consider adding accessibility features (ARIA labels, keyboard navigation) for better user experience
For production use, implement unique ID generation (UUID library) instead of array indices
The implementation meets the basic requirements of the task description which asked for 'a todo app in react js' without specifying advanced features

completion.changelog: Created a React-based todo application with core task management features including add, toggle, and delete functionality using functional components and hooks.
